result.name: Apache HTTP Server Multiple Vulnerabilities

nvt.name: Apache HTTP Server Multiple Vulnerabilities
nvt.summary: The remote Apache HTTP Server is prone to multiple vulnerabilities.

result.description: Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.0 through 2.4.55 are affected by multiple vulnerabilities including HTTP request smuggling and mod_proxy_uwsgi HTTP response splitting.

result.name: OpenSSL Multiple Vulnerabilities

nvt.name: OpenSSL Multiple Vulnerabilities
nvt.summary: The remote OpenSSL installation is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.

result.description: OpenSSL versions before 3.1.1, 3.0.9, and 1.1.1u are vulnerable to excessive resource consumption during certificate verification and policy processing.

result.name: MySQL Server Multiple Vulnerabilities

nvt.name: MySQL Server Multiple Vulnerabilities
nvt.summary: The remote MySQL server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.

result.description: MySQL Server versions 8.0.32 and earlier are vulnerable to unauthorized access and privilege escalation attacks.

result.name: Docker Engine Privilege Escalation

nvt.name: Docker Engine Privilege Escalation
nvt.summary: The remote Docker Engine is vulnerable to privilege escalation.

result.description: Docker Engine versions before 23.0.3 allow attackers to escape container isolation and gain host privileges through malicious container images.

result.name: Nginx HTTP Request Smuggling

nvt.name: Nginx HTTP Request Smuggling
nvt.summary: The remote Nginx server is vulnerable to HTTP request smuggling.

result.description: Nginx versions before 1.25.2 are vulnerable to HTTP/2 rapid reset attacks that can lead to denial of service conditions.
